title: Collaborative and Problem-Based Learning Design Using Educational Robotics for K-12 Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic robotics concepts, programming languages (block coding) comprehension, and fundamental principles of electronic circuits
context.additional_context: Team-based virtual robot simulation tools in a BYOD environment, with twice-weekly 90-minute synchronous sessions + asynchronous assignments.

learning_goals: Learners can perform effective communication and role distribution within teams of up to three members to solve robotics problems
Learners can analyze real-world robotics design problems, develop problem-solving strategies, and implement them in a simulation environment
Learners can produce outcomes applying strategic thinking, dynamic problem-solving, and creative approaches during project-based collaborative learning
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
